taskGroup.name: Event-B XText Basic Tutorial
taskGroup.intro: Introduction This tutorial provides a step-by-step walk-through working with XEvent-B constructs.
taskGroup.onCompletion: Conclusion You should now be familiar with the syntax of XEvent-B constructs, i.e., XContexts and XMachines, and their compilation to Rodin constructs, i.e., Contexts and Machines. While the outer syntax is checked by XEvent-B, the inner syntax (e.g., within mathematical expressions and predicates) is checked at the Rodin Event-B level.

task.name: Task 1. Customise the Event-B Explorer
task.intro: Introduction The purpose of this task is to customise the Event-B Explorer so that XEvent-B constructs are visible.
task.onCompletion: Conclusion Since the filter on "All files and folders" is now disabled, there might be other files and folders than XEvent-B constructs will also be visible in the Event-B Explorer.

task.name: Task 2. Create an Event-B Project
task.intro: Introduction The purpose of this task is to create an Event-B project for the XEvent-B constructs.
task.onCompletion: Conclusion By now, the project "Club" should be visible in the Event-B Explorer.

task.name: Task 3. Create a simple XContext coursesCtx.bucx
task.intro: Introduction The purpose of this task is to create a simple XContext within the newly created project.
task.onCompletion: Conclusion By now, the XContext "coursesCtx.bucx" and the corresponding Rodin Context "coursesCtx" should be visible in the Event-B Explorer.

task.name: Task 4. Create a simple XMachine m0.bumx
task.intro: Introduction The purpose of this task is to create a simple XMachine within the newly created project.
task.onCompletion: Conclusion By now, the XMachine"m0.bumx" and the corresponding Rodin Machine "m0" (without any error) should be visible in the Event-B Explorer.
